gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: COAL_UND, the predecessor of COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN, is a polygon-based ESRI ArcView shapefile that shows the location and extent of underground coal mines in the coal region of west-central and southwestern Indiana. COAL_UND includes locations for all documented underground mines that operated in Indiana since the late 1800s. COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN is attributed to allow the mine polygons to be differentiated based on mine type, mine number, source information, and dates of mining.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN is a compilation of all underground mine locations in Indiana. COAL_UND was compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) as part of a contract deliverable for the Abandoned Mine Lands program of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation. COAL_UND incorporates underground mine locations compiled by the IGS in the early 1980s with hundreds of historic underground mine locations digitized in 1998-1999 and contemporary mine outlines digitized from maps collected from maps collected from coal companies or the Indiana Bureau of Mines. Original source information for COAL_UND includes company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, and Indiana State Mine Inspector Reports. All mine data included in COAL_UND are organized in a GIS using ESRI ArcGIS software of the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) on the Windows platform. Scale of source data ranges from 1:4,800 to 1:100,000. COAL_UND includes attributes which allow the mine polygons to be differentiated based on mine type, mine number, source information, and dates of mining.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. The following citation should be included: COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN: Underground Coal Mines in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile). gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.

All underground coal mines included in this shapefile were compiled as part of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS) project at the Indiana Geological Survey. The CMIS is an integrated geographic information system (GIS) and database management system (DBMS) created to maintain spatial and tabular data related to coal mines in the Indiana portion of the Illinois Basin. The CMIS includes spatial mine data compiled from all known sources including: company mine maps (from the Indiana Bureau of Mines, county courthouses, coal companies), field maps and notes of IGS Geologists, IGS publications, and Indiana State Mine Inspector Reports. In compiling data for the CMIS, every effort was made to ensure data accuracy and completeness. However, it is known that undocumented underground mining has occurred in the study area. Also, because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual extent of underground mining may not coincide with the boundaries portrayed in this shapefile.

Two tests for attribute consistency were performed by IGS personnel using the QueryBuilder Tool in Arcview. (1) Completeness of values was verified. - No values were left blank. (2) Validity of values was verified. - All features were attributed with values in the appropriate range and format.

Mine outlines included in this shapefile were compiled from several sources with varying map scales. Thus, the horizontal positional accuracy of individual polygons may vary. If highly detailed mine location and layout information is needed, refer to the original source maps, many of which are included in Indiana Geological Survey Open-file Study 98-08, Abandoned Underground Coal Mine Workings Maps. Because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual extent of underground mining may not coincide with the boundaries portrayed in this shapefile.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the creation of COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN. No quantitative tests were performed.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Active underground mine outlines were digitized from maps collected annually from the Indiana Bureau of Mines. COAL_UND was updated to include the updated underground mining areas and renamed COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN.

Mine outlines from a variety of sources including company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS Geologists, IGS publications, and Indiana State Mine Inspector Reports were rescaled and hand-plotted on 1:24,000-scale quadrangle maps. This data set, comprised of nearly 100 quadrangle maps, was compiled by IGS personnel in the mid-1980s to create the first complete compilation of underground mine locations in Indiana.

Polygons from the Indiana Geological Survey 1:24,000-scale Underground Coal Mine Maps were digitized by Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) personnel in the late 1980s to create the first coal mine GIS for the IGS and the Indiana Division of Reclamation. Outlines were digitized using ESRI PC ArcInfo and geo-referenced using 8 tics from 1:24,000-scale quadrangle maps.

Data from the early coal mine GIS were converted to a new GIS format and updated with new mine data. Using ESRI ArcInfo version 7.2.1, polygons were extracted from the old GIS coverages and integrated into a new REGION-based GIS format. Each polygon was attributed with source information, dates of mining, and coal seam data. The resulting reformatted mine coverages (over 4,000 including surface and underground coal mines) constitute the primary mine GIS data for the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS), an integrated geographic information system and database management system. In addition to the reformatting, over 1,000 mine coverages were added to the GIS, including approximately 225 new surface mines, 20 new underground mines, and nearly 1,200 historic underground mine entrance locations.

CMIS mine data were updated with information collected for the Directory of Coal Mines and Producers in Indiana - 2000. The update included approximately 40 surface mine polygons and 5 underground mine polygons. Most data were received in digital format from mining companies and converted to suitable format by IGS personnel.

Mine coverages from the Indiana Coal Mine Information System were appended using an AML running in ESRI ArcInfo version 7.2.1. The resulting coverage included all mines in the Indiana coal region. This coverage was then projected to UTM zone 16 Nad 83 using the ESRI ArcView Projector extension. COAL_UND was created in ESRI ArcView by using the ESRI ArcView QueryBuilder to select only underground mines and then by using the Convert-to-Shapefile command to create a new shapefile from the selected data.
ArcInfo underground mine coverages were converted to an ESRI personal geodatabase feature dataset.
Active underground mine outlines were digitized from maps collected annually from the Indiana Bureau of Mines. COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN was updated to include the updated underground mining areas.
Active underground mine outlines were digitized from maps collected annually from the Indiana Bureau of Mines. COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN was updated to include the updated underground mining areas.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Used to create the first complete compilation of underground mine locations in Indiana.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
